Detailed Description

Select the next microcode word to execute.

The microcode_branch module is responsible for selecting the next microcode word to execute. This decision is based on the value of the current microcode word, the value of the interrupt privilege level, the state of the current bus cycle and other internal signals.

The microcode_branch module implements a simple stack for the microcode addresses. This makes it possible to call subroutines inside the microcode.

03557 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03558     if(reset_n == 1'b0) micro_pc_0 <= 9'd0;
03559     else                micro_pc_0 <= micro_pc;
03560 end

Definition at line 3562 of file ao68000.v.

 
03562 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03563     if(reset_n == 1'b0) begin
03564         micro_pc_1 <= 9'd0;
03565         micro_pc_2 <= 9'd0;
03566         micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03567     end
03568     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_stop_flag_wait_ir_decode && prefetch_ir_valid == 1'b1 && decoder_trap == 8'd0)
03569     begin
03570         micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + { 5'd0, branch_offset };
03571         micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03572         micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03573     end
03574     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_procedure) begin
03575         if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea != 9'd0) begin
03576             micro_pc_1 <= perform_ea_read;
03577             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03578             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_1;
03579         end
03580         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea == 9'd0) begin
03581             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03582             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03583             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03584         end
03585         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_write && save_ea != 9'd0) begin
03586             micro_pc_1 <= save_ea;
03587             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03588             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03589         end
03590         else if((branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_load_ea && load_ea != 9'd0) ||
03591                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_read) ||
03592                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_write) ||
03593                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_save_ea && save_ea != 9'd0) ||
03594                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_trap) )
03595         begin
03596             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03597             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03598             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03599         end
03600         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_return) begin
03601             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03602             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03603             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03604         end
03605         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_push_micropc) begin
03606             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0;
03607             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03608             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03609         end
03610         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_pop_micropc) begin
03611             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03612             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03613             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03614         end
03615     end
03616 end
